;Xiang Biao sat among a group of young people in Guangzhou, laughing with everyone, occasionally frowning and speaking, More often than not, listening to each person’s thoughts, experiences, and traumas. Most of these traumas come from family of origin and close relationships. Sometimes everyone forgets that Xiang Biao exists. During a party, he quietly got up to wash the dishes, and almost no one noticed him. These young people are participants in the "Seeing the First 500 Meters" social art workshop launched by artists He Zhisen and Xiang Biao, as well as Duan Zhipeng, a doctoral student at the Oslo School of Architecture and Design. The works of the workshop have participated in the 9th Shenzhen-Hong Kong Urban/Architecture Biennale.

;

;The last time Xiang Biao returned to China was in 2019 before the epidemic. Xiang Biao is the director of the Max Planck Institute for Social Anthropology in Germany and a professor of social anthropology at the University of Oxford in the UK. He became famous for his research on Zhejiang Village in Beijing. After many years abroad, he has become active in the Chinese-speaking world again in recent years.

;

;When Xiang Biao returned to China this time, he frequently chatted with various people. For example, every time he took a taxi, he didn’t want to miss the opportunity to talk to the driver. In his hometown of Wenzhou, he found that most taxi drivers were over 45 years old and usually had another job. A driver told Xiang Biao that he helped people open credit cards. Xiang Biao was curious about who else was using credit cards now that mobile payment is so convenient. The driver said that some people need small loans for short-term turnover. And looking for customers to open a card involves the gray chain of data buying and selling. In an online car-hailing car in Guangzhou, when the conversation came up about the career of the driver's son, he pointed to the platform recording equipment in the car and made a shushing gesture, and the conversation stopped. "These are all new points for me. I don't know if they are useful, but they can help me discover the richness of society." Xiang Biao told Southern Weekend reporters.

;

;Xiang Biao said that he is a person who is far away from art. He almost never watches movies and rarely goes to art galleries and exhibition halls. There was only one exception when he served as a judge for a German artist’s application project. . "This is a German habit, to find people with different subject backgrounds to participate in the review." He said. The "Seeing the First 500 Meters" workshop is his most in-depth participation in a public art and social art activity. His original idea was to encourage everyone to go to the community and meet strangers, but on the one hand, due to the uncertainty caused by the epidemic in 2022; on the other hand, many people found that if the radius of 500 meters continued to be reduced, the things they were most concerned about would be , is family and companionship. As a result, many of the workshop's works were skewed. Everyone's anxiety is superimposed on social and personal life.

;

;He Zhisen once held an exhibition in a vegetable market in Guangzhou. On the podium of South China University of Technology, he said that he had held more than 100 workshops, and most of them dispersed after seeing the first 500 people. m” members are the most closely connected. I heard that Xiang Biao made a special trip to Guangzhou to chat with everyone. Some of the participants in the workshop came from Nanjing and some from abroad. On this day, Xiang Biao sat quietly in the back row of the lecture hall, like an older student. He followed workshop member Manman through the noisy lanes and handshake buildings of Shipai Village to the art space in the urban village. This space, known as the "mobile club", was originally a garbage recycling station. Xiang Biao talked with everyone about Wenzhou, the south, and the differences between the north and the south of China.

;

;;

;

;In October 2023, Xiang Biao (first from left in the back row) communicated with young people at the "Mobile Club", an art space in Guangzhou. ;;

;

;Xiang Biao found that he was more popular among young people in China than he imagined, but he did not feel that he was a young person not as a mentor, but as an interlocutor. Dialogue research is also his working method in facing the research direction of "common anxiety". In October 2023, Southern Weekend reporters conducted an exclusive interview with Xiang Biao in Guangzhou.

;

;Understanding art through anthropology, "recognition" is different from "understanding"

;

;;Southern Weekend:;;Why has the contemporary art world paid more and more attention to anthropology in recent years? ;

;

;;Xiang Biao: ;;The so-called elite art collected in galleries and museums can do a lot in terms of methods, techniques and forms of expression. But if it is public art, if you only make breakthroughs in form and method, it will be meaningless to the common people. Others will not know what your breakthrough is, and it cannot evoke that kind of resonance. The common people will not understand what you are doing. If there is no connection with his life, then he cannot participate or be further stimulated. ;

;

;At this time, public art needs to be ideological, to find a problem, and then this problem can be expressed in a very condensed artistic way, whether it is a drama, an installation, or a painting. Well, once you express it, everyone can recognize it, and at the same time, the way you express it makes everyone see that this is a door, and they can't help but open it. There is a space behind the door. This way everyone can participate.

;

;Such an artistic work must have a certain degree of thought, a large amount of observation of experience, a very detailed and sincere appreciation, and then sublimate an image, a motif, and a core symbol.

;

;Then why is anthropology, rather than general social sciences or psychology, communicating with art? Because anthropology is to see some problems and truths from very specific experiences. It is not like philosophy, which starts from an existing problem, such as "What is a good person?"; it is also not like sociology, Think from a macro social phenomenon. Anthropology uses daily behavior to see some of the problems behind it, so anthropology has a strong sense of recognition. People can tell at a glance that this is related to them.

;

;;Southern Weekend:;;How do you understand "sense of recognition"? ;

;

;;Xiang Biao: ;;Recognition means that when you see something, it evokes your understanding of your own life experience, and it will produce a mutual projection. So recognition is very important. Our understanding of the world must be based on our own life experience. You mobilize your memory and then make a new interpretation of this thing. This is called recognition. If you don’t understand, you just don’t recognize it. ;

;

;For example, whether it is Kafka or Benjamin, if we do not have a good understanding of European culture, we cannot recognize them. In fact, what he said is very direct in his context, and it is easy for people with similar life experiences to recognize it.

;

;Just like when we look at Lu Xun, it is difficult for young people today to understand Lu Xun, also because they do not recognize it. This does not mean that you can solve it through knowledge and logic. Of course, it does not rule out that there is a purely literal and logical way. You think you understand it, but you are completely unable to mobilize your own experience. (This situation) actually happens a lot. We all feel this way when we read some documents.

;

;There are many people who engage in academic research and art. In fact, their understanding is not based on their own life experience, but on establishing relationships between texts, which can also form an understanding. Or logical interpretation, it feels like you understand it, but the effect of this understanding is very different from what we call "recognition".

;

;;Southern Weekend:;;The participants of the workshop you met in Guangzhou this time, Most of them are very young. Did you encounter any new excitement while communicating with everyone? ;

;

;;Xiang Biao: ;;Of course there is a lot of excitement. They are not willing to adopt the mainstream meritocracy (to live), and may not necessarily be successful in a secular sense. Some people have just resigned. Their backgrounds are quite diverse, including carpenters, civil servants, video makers, and marketers. There are also people who study art, not particularly many, but these people all have a certain sense of art. Artistic sense means that they are more sensitive to their own perceptions. They may not necessarily think about these sensitivities, but the "sensitivity" will stay on him or her, and it is a bit sticky and will not be easily brushed off. Artistic people are sensitive and adhesive people. ;

;

;The workshop was a great education for me. It made me softer and paid more attention to people's subjective emotions. As I just said, these young people are not very mainstream. Many of them are weak and not very confident. There were several people who could barely speak at the beginning of last year, couldn't sleep the day before the meeting, and were so nervous. Many young people I have interacted with before, such as students at Oxford, are very talkative. Oxford is a famous place for cultivating politicians. But many of the expressions of the young people in this workshop were inconsistent. This kind of difficult expression sometimes turns into awkward silence, but once he or she speaks, you can feel that there are very rich feelings behind it.

;

;According to my previous habits, the efficiency of this kind of communication is very low. I am a relatively rational person and have been pursuing clarity. I now realize that I was actually very closed-minded and had a very single perception of the world. I need more patience, this is an education for me. I think that to promote many things here, we cannot all do them in a rational way. Art is a good tool. I listen more. Before, I didn’t pay enough attention to the richness and sensitivity of emotions, and the many mixed and unclear things, but now I pay more attention to them.

;

;“I am not a mentor, but an interlocutor”

;

;;Southern Weekend:;;How do you interact with the audience during lectures or online live broadcasts? ;

;

;;Xiang Biao: ;;After the speech, the questions asked by the public fell into two categories. The first type is to ask questions based on the concepts I proposed. To be honest, this kind of question is not particularly meaningful. In the end, it turned into me having to define and explain the concepts. What is really impactful are the second type of questions, which are very specific questions based on life experience. It's a difficult question to answer, but it gives me some punch. For example, some parents will ask me, saying that involution is not good. My child's grades are getting worse and worse. Should I send him to tutoring? No matter how I answer, this parent will most likely send their children to make up classes. Then my answer may be, how you define make-up lessons when you interact with your children is very critical. I can feel the parent's anxiety and entanglement. I can't change the objective environment, but the more useful and appropriate answer to him is how to define, state, and treat this matter. ;

;

;We may need to distinguish between thinking and thoughts. Thinking is inferential and requires rigorous logic; thinking is divergent and multi-dimensional. This kind of dialogue allowed me to change from one-dimensional thinking to richer and more sensitive thinking.

;

;;Southern Weekend:;;What are the differences between the academic workshops you participated in? ;

;

;;Xiang Biao: ;;That kind of workshop requires using very clear words to express, theoretically and conceptually speaking about life, and it takes a lot of time. Generally no more than three days. This "Seeing the First 500 Meters" is completely different. It is open, does not have a fixed theme, and is against conceptualization. ;

;

;;Southern Weekend:;;Many young people like to communicate with you, and they are very Trust you. Do you consider yourself a mentor to young people? ;

;

;;Xiang Biao: ;;I was quite surprised when I returned to China this time. I found that I am more popular than I thought. How eager young people are. Beyond my imagination. But I don’t feel like a mentor to young people. I hate the role of mentor. When I was a young man, I didn’t pay much attention to life mentors, so I won’t become the character I hate. I am a conversationalist. ;

;

;I think the most important thing is not that I tell you what you should do, but that I inspire you to think more. I will raise some questions, highlight some paradoxes, do some analysis, make you think, and let us find that the original thinking may be a bit simple. This is my job. Even if I have some so-called advice, it's about how to think, not about what to do morally and behaviorally.

;

;;Southern Weekend:;;But it is true that when many young people ask you questions, they will ask about Regarding issues such as anxiety and involution, there is a feeling of expecting you to be a life mentor. ;

;

;;Xiang Biao: ;;I don’t think so. They would also ask each other these questions at friends' gatherings. They would say that the involution has become like this, what should I do? These questions are not only asked among friends and relatives, but also asked by oneself at night when I can't sleep. I think maybe that question occupied his mind and it would come out naturally, so he would ask that question to everyone. ;

;

;What’s interesting is how I answer such a question. He knew I wouldn't give him an answer, couldn't show him a path. Most people don't think so. What he actually asked was how to face a problem that is known to have no solution. So I put myself in his situation, understand his situation, and respond with sincerity, which may be more effective. This is completely a friendship-like communication, not a mentor-mentee relationship.

;

;;Southern Weekend:;;The book "Use Yourself as a Method" is a best-seller, maybe That’s why young people are inspired by you. As an anthropologist, why have you been more willing to give interviews or appear in mass media in recent years? ;

;

;;Xiang Biao: ;;In the 19th and 20th centuries, when social science first emerged, the world was very different from today. The difference between scholars and non-scholars at that time Very big at the time. For example, a European scholar needs to learn ancient Greek, Latin, and various philosophies. Chinese scholars like Liang Qichao and Yan Fu first introduced social sciences, and most of the people are illiterate. But in the 21st century, our youth’s level of education, their ability to think and master knowledge, and their information are no different from those of scholars. And we often think that the experts are among the people. Some of the things on site B are actually more interesting than those written by scholars in many academies. This means that academic research cannot start from its own academic propositions like it did in the 19th and 20th centuries, and write an article for two to three hundred people to read it. The public will not know what is going on. That will not work. ;

;

;So my work in Germany is to advocate a new research style, which does not start from academic propositions, but from public anxiety itself, using "anxiety" as the title, Come and study together. In other words, it is conversational research. Everyone has their own life and their own struggles, and the taste inside is different from what we see outside. Our output should be about how to deal with the world, giving thinking methods, concepts and theoretical perspectives, and triggering more discussions. For conversational research, communication in the public media is very important. This is my working method, not a supplementary one, but a fundamental working method. It’s not that I have any conclusions to tell you, but that they collide and deepen in the constant back and forth.

;

;;Southern Weekend:;;What forms of communication have you received during this kind of dialogue and back-and-forth? feedback? After all, you haven’t opened an account at station B, so feedback is not given through barrage. ;

;

;;Xiang Biao: ;;I find that contemporary art is particularly sensitive. In 2020, there will be four domestic exhibitions with the title "Nearby". In fact, "nearby" is a very vague thing in academic terms. I didn't find it very interesting myself, I just mentioned it in a general way. The “nearby” concept received enthusiastic feedback. When I proposed the term “country squire,” the feedback I received was less enthusiastic and more questioning and critical. There are also some topics that I find interesting but receive a mediocre response from the public. ;

;

;Someone will find my email online and write to me. It's not that the question he raised is meaningful in itself, but I will think about why he raised such a question. I know that some issues are universal, and I will have to observe them over a period of time. So feedback is not given directly to me, it requires a process.

;

;Common Anxiety and Type 16 Personality

;

;;Southern Weekend:;; During your return to China, you chatted intensively with various people almost every day. Have you always been so talkative? ;

;

;;Xiang Biao: ;;I haven’t tested it yet. I am not a very extroverted person. Sometimes I am a little socially anxious, and I have been insensitive to people's subjective emotions for a long time. I have always felt that I have mild autism. I read the biography of an analytical philosopher in Oxford. He often talked to others, but everyone found that he was indifferent to many common sense things and had no interest in interpersonal relationships. The understanding is very simple, but the analysis of some things can be very profound. I think this is very similar to me. ;

;

;To be honest, I am quite introverted and afraid of eating with many people. When chatting on that occasion, few people can tell the complete story of their experiences. The content of the conversation can easily turn into various fragments, gossip, and extreme stories, many of which are hearsay. I'm surprised that many intellectual elites also like to talk about this. In that environment, it was difficult for me to maintain myself. I became very quiet and wanted to end it quickly.

;

;;Southern Weekend:;;Nowadays, it is very popular among Chinese young people to talk about type 16 personality. We often talk to each other Asked "Are you an I person or an E person?" What do you think of this phenomenon? ;

;

;;Xiang Biao: ;;Personality classification is a very interesting phenomenon. It is not the same as young people’s original curiosity about psychology. If you want to understand your own mental state and understand yourself, it is now mainly a social tool. You know each other's type, and then you can profile each other, and then ask each other questions. But this question does not necessarily mean that you need to prescribe the right medicine (according to the other person's personality type). , but it means that there is no way to start communication with a natural word, and using personality classification can talk more safely. This has a lot to do with the role of social media. We are used to interacting with personas, that is, types of people and people in portraits, but we don’t quite know how to interact with the people themselves. ;

;

;;Southern Weekend:;;Most academic research now revolves around topics , do you consider yourself a lucky person for having conversations and researching shared anxieties in this way? ;

;

;;Xiang Biao: ;;I am very lucky. I was already very lucky in Oxford. When I arrived at the Max Planck Institute in Germany, the constraints on me became even more severe. Less, and it gives you a platform that encourages you to do weird things. In the direction of "common anxiety", we have postdocs working on "pressure" in Africa, and some working on "persistence" in Latin America. In what specific life situations, what issues and in what ways do people make persistent investments? What can this teach us. This is different from a philosophical discussion; it is a very realistic observation. ;

;

;;Southern Weekend:;;Why do you pay special attention to "anxiety"? Why conduct conversational research starting from “shared anxieties” rather than, say, “shared concerns”? ;

;

;;Xiang Biao: ;;Public concerns are often shaped by a mainstream discourse and can be easily expressed directly with some data. Concerns are integrated and conceptual. Anxiety is emotional and closer to the experience of life itself. For ordinary people, the purpose of life is not to criticize, but to live better. Of course, there are many things worthy of criticism, but only when they come out of the purpose of their lives can criticism be implemented and facilitate their actions, and then they can change lives and people's thinking under a seemingly unchangeable structure. ;

;

;Studying anxiety is much more difficult than studying public concerns or a certain issue, because anxiety is a vague thing that cannot be explained clearly, let alone quantified. . This means that we must find new languages ​​and new ways of thinking. It is easy to follow the agenda, but it is also difficult to innovate. But starting from anxiety, we can better grasp the current new contradictions.

;

;;Southern Weekend:;;"Anxiety" has been a hot word for a long time in recent years. What are your observations on everyone’s anxiety? ;

;

;;Xiang Biao: ;;The anxiety is more serious than I thought, and it is very pervasive. I could see the current high incidence of mental illness from reports. Then through conversations with young people, chatting and contacting various people, I saw more from experience how people describe anxiety and how anxiety is. Spreading, including in intimate relationships, anxiety is amplified or distorted. At the same time, everyone realizes that they are anxious, which means that everyone is looking forward to a change, or at least a better way to respond to their situation. ;

;

;One cause of anxiety is a disruption in our perception of life. When there is a huge swing in life, without adequate discussion and communication after the swing, ordinary people will not be able to form a complete understanding of the development of things. There must be various traumas involved. This trauma remains on ourselves. If we don’t handle it well, it will remain there forever and turn into fear, weakness, nervousness, violent reactions, etc. in our future.

;

;People often ask me, why don’t you criticize? In fact, criticism is still very important, but I focus more on analyzing the trauma on our bodies, how we treat it, and how to preserve our own strength.

;Kwong Siu-ching, the wife of 94-year-old Sun Hung Kai Properties (0016.HK) founder Guo Desheng, invested 72 billion yuan in Net worth, she became the richest woman in China for the first time; Yang Huiyan, the "tenth consecutive winner" as the richest woman, dropped to fifth place; nearly 60 of the 50 female entrepreneurs on the list started from scratch, and real estate is still their largest source of wealth.

;

;On November 14, Hurun Research Institute and the Business Women's Growth and Social Platform Hong Kong Beauty Club jointly released the "2023 Hong Kong Beauty Club·Hurun Women Entrepreneurs List" (hereinafter referred to as the "Hurun Women Entrepreneurs List") as shown above information. This is the eighteenth consecutive time that Hurun Research Institute has released this list, and the deadline for wealth calculation is September 1, 2023. Unlike the Hurun Rich List, the list of female entrepreneurs separately calculates the personal wealth of female entrepreneurs that can be separated from family wealth.

;

;94-year-old "No. 1 Tenant" Kuang Xiaoqing became the richest woman in China

;

; "In the past 18 years, the threshold for the top 50 Chinese female entrepreneurs has increased from 500 million to 13.5 billion , increased nearly 30 times." Hurun Report, chairman and chief research officer of Hurun Report, said above. However, judging from the Hurun Report's overall list, the proportion of female entrepreneurs dropped by 1.3 percentage points to 25.4%.

;

;The Hurun Women Entrepreneurs List shows that 94-year-old Kuang Xiaoqing became the richest woman in China for the first time with a wealth of 72 billion yuan. She is also the sixth richest woman in China in the past 18 years on the Hurun Women Entrepreneurs List. The top five are Zhang Yin (three times) ), Yang Huiyan (ten times), Wu Yajun (twice), Zhou Qunfei (once), Chen Lihua (once). Wu Yajun, the founder of Longfor Real Estate, remains the richest self-made woman in China with 66.5 billion yuan.

;

;;;

; (Hurun Female Entrepreneurs List TOP10, Source: Hurun Report)

;

;Public information shows that Kuang Xiaoqingsheng Born in Huashan Town, Huadu District, Guangdong Province in 1929, she is the wife of Hong Kong entrepreneur and founder of Sun Hung Kai Properties, Kwok Desheng, with a total wealth of 72 billion yuan. She is also the largest shareholder of Sun Hung Kai Properties. She is highly respected in the family and is the soul of Sun Hung Kai Properties.

;

;Sun Hung Kai Properties is one of the largest real estate developers in Hong Kong. According to data from Sun Hung Kai Properties in fiscal year 2023 (July 1, 2022 to June 30, 2023), the company’s operating income was HK$71.2 billion. Net profit attributable to the parent company was HK$23.91 billion, with a net profit margin of 34.52%, a year-on-year increase of 2.7%.

;

;Kuang Xiaoqing is known as "China's No. 1 Housekeeper". Judging from the financial reports of Sun Hung Kai Properties in the past five years, property rental has always contributed the largest proportion of revenue, about one-third. Judging from the latest financial report, as of June 30, 2023, Sun Hung Kai Properties' land bank in Hong Kong is approximately 58 million square feet (approximately 5.38 million square meters), of which more than 60% are diversified properties, most of which are used for Leasing and long-term investment bring considerable recurring income to the group.

;

;According to Hurun Report, Kuang Xiaoqing became the richest woman in China for the first time, mainly benefiting from the rise in the Hong Kong dollar exchange rate this year and company dividends.

;

;Judging from the rise in the Hong Kong dollar exchange rate, since the beginning of this year, the RMB exchange rate against the Hong Kong dollar has risen from around 0.8 to around 0.9, with a maximum of around 0.93.

;

;Judging from the company's dividends, Flush shows that Sun Hung Kai Properties is one of the blue-chip stocks that have been purchased the most by domestic investors, with a cumulative cash distribution of HK$71.72 billion in the past five years. In fiscal year 2023 (July 1, 2022 to June 30, 2023), the company will distribute cash twice, with an amount of HK$14.34 billion, and a dividend payout ratio of 60%.

;

;It is worth noting that in the latest fiscal year (dividend payment date is November 16), Sun Hung Kai Properties paid a dividend of HK$3.7 per share, which was three times the dividend of the previous fiscal year. Kwong Xiaoqing personally holds less than 0.01% of Sun Hung Kai Properties, which is 25,020 shares. Kwong Xiaoqing and his immediate family members jointly hold 19.5% of Sun Hung Kai Properties' shares, totaling 565 million shares. Based on a dividend payout of HK$3.7 per share, Kuang Xiaoqing’s personal shareholding and the shareholding jointly held with others will make a profit of approximately HK$2.091 billion.

;

;The ranking of "Ten Crowns" Yang Huiyan dropped to fifth place

;

;In this list, another major focus is the substantial wealth of Yang Huiyan, who has won the title of the richest woman ten times. Shrunk, ranking fell to fifth.

;

;Judging from the changes in the Hurun Women Entrepreneurs list, Country Garden Chairman and Executive Director Yang Huiyan’s wealth has shrunk the most in 2023 compared to last year (27 billion yuan), ranking 5th with 48 billion yuan; followed by It is Cheng Xue, CEO of Haitian Flavor Industry, whose performance has declined due to the additive incident, and his wealth has shrunk by 16.5 billion yuan; and Zhao Yan, chairman of Bloomage International Investment Group, the "Queen of Hyaluronic Acid", whose wealth has shrunk by 14.5 billion yuan.

;

;Born in 1981, Yang Huiyan is the second daughter of Country Garden founder Yang Guoqiang. In 2005, Yang Huiyan returned to China after graduating from the Ohio State University majoring in marketing and logistics, and joined Country Garden as Yang Guoqiang's personal assistant and served as purchasing manager. She has held important positions in Country Garden Investment Center, Procurement Department, Human Resources Center, Digital Management Center and other departments. In March 2023, Yang Huiyan officially became the successor of the family business and served as the chairman of the board of directors of Country Garden.

;

;In April 2007, Country Garden was listed in Hong Kong, and Yang Guoqiang transferred all his shares to Yang Huiyan. 26-year-old Yang Huiyan topped the 2007 Forbes rich list with $16.02 billion, and became China's new richest woman. In the 16 years from 2007 to 2022, Yang Huiyan aspired to be the richest woman in China ten times. It is worth noting that Yang Huiyan’s wealth has shrunk by nearly 60% year-on-year in 2022, but she still ranks first.

;

;;;

;(Yang Huiyan aspired to be the richest woman in China ten times, source: Hurun Report) 

;

;Yang Huiyan’s wealth has shrunk and Country Garden Crisis is closely related. In 2023, due to increasing uncertainty in the macro economy and real estate, Country Garden's debt has frequently shown red lights. "Faced with the two-way tightening on the consumer side and the financing side, the group's liquidity is under unprecedented pressure." Country Garden said in its 2023 mid-term report. From Country Garden's annual and interim reports for the past five years, we can find that Country Garden's strategic goals have changed from prudent and pragmatic replenishment of high-quality land reserves to "guaranteing the delivery of buildings" and making every effort to arrange debt repayments.

;

;On July 30, 2023, Country Garden Services (6098.HK) announced that Yang Huiyan, the company’s controlling shareholder, non-executive director and chairman of the board of directors, donated RMB 64 million to Guoqiang Charity Foundation (Hong Kong) Co., Ltd. HK$100 million worth of stocks will be used for charity. But this move caused controversy in the market.

;

;In addition, the Hurun Women Entrepreneurs List shows that the number of new female billionaires on the list is 8, which is the lowest in 18 years and 3 less than last year. Among the newcomers, the top one is Zhou Chaonan of Runze Technology, which is engaged in the big data center and computing infrastructure industry, with a wealth of 20 billion yuan; followed by Shu Ping, one of the founders of Haidilao, with a wealth of 18 billion yuan; and then Yulon of Taiwan. Car boss Yan Chen Lillian has a wealth of 16 billion yuan. Newcomers also include Ye Qiongjiu, director and deputy general manager of Tonghuashun, with a wealth of 13.5 billion yuan.  

;

;Nearly 60% of female entrepreneurs started from scratch. Real estate is still the largest source of wealth

;

;From the perspective of wealth sources, nearly 60% of female entrepreneurs started from scratch, and nearly 40% inherited it. .  

;

;Specifically, the Hurun Female Entrepreneurs List shows that there are 34 self-made female entrepreneurs in 2023, accounting for 59%, which is basically the same as last year; 24 are not self-made, 2 fewer than last year position, accounting for 41%, compared with 43% last year.  

;

;Self-made female entrepreneurs mainly start their own businesses or start businesses with their husbands. ; Wed, 15 Nov 2023 17:55:04 +0800 教育不是功名利禄的“油门”，而是做人做事的“把门”http://www.infzm.com/contents/260571
;;2023-11-15 17:00:00;
;

;三叔来找我诉苦，说又帮堂弟还了一万元的债务，然后照例感慨一句“还是你们念书好啊”，这个“啊”字是一声长叹，包含着三叔很多思绪。

;

;时光倒回二十年，三叔对于念书的态度并非一个“好”字，而是有他自己的判断。他自身是个能人，力气大，脑子灵，各种农活手拿把掐不在话下，到城里打工也能立刻适应，从技能到人际，游刃有余，既赚钱，也赚人缘。因此，他家的日子在本村最殷实，称得上“首富”，属于“村东头跺跺脚，村西头颤三颤”的人物。

;

;他常说，自己没读几天书，没接受过啥高深的教育，但日子过得比别人都强。上学念书，最终还是要过日子，只要日子过得好，受不受教育不要太在乎。因此，在别人家都为孩子成绩不好着急的时候，三叔很淡然，对堂弟的成绩不关心，考了100分不表扬，考个不及格也不打骂，并告诉自己的儿子，挣多少分不算本事，关键是会挣钱。三叔对于学校教育是这个态度，对于家庭教育是这样灌输——只要掌握了挣钱的本事，你就赢了。

;

;三叔对那些在教育上投入太多钱和精力的家庭很不屑，尤其是对我家。那个时候的学费虽不算高，但对于农村家庭仍是不小的负担，每到开学前，很多父母都为学费犯愁，甚至开学后好长时间，才会凑齐。三叔对凑学费的做法表示不理解，既然没钱，为啥还要去上，上了小学，要上中学，还要上大学，毕业之后如果没找到工作或者工作不好，那投了十多年的钱不就打了水漂？

;

;后来我中考发挥失常，觉得够不着录取线，很沮丧失落，亲戚朋友不好来安慰，只有三叔过来告诉我，别着急，大不了和他一起去学修车，比念书简单，还能挣钱。搞得我哭笑不得，好在只是虚惊，一个月后我成功进入高中读书。

;

;因为有教育观念的分歧，父亲和三叔的关系很微妙，兄弟二人经常会在吃饭喝酒时，为了这个分歧吵起来，闹个不欢而散。父亲开始是坚定的，也一直给我打气，说砸锅卖铁也要念书。但随着堂弟进入社会，父亲的心有些动摇了。

;

;堂弟在三叔的不管之下，勉强挨到初中毕业，就再也不肯上学，想出去城市里闯一闯，三叔表示支持，并把他托付给一个做生意的亲戚照料。三叔给了堂弟一笔钱，让他自己去赚第一桶金。堂弟年纪不大，但继承了三叔的才干，不到18岁就已在城里混个风生水起，起码开始往家里拿钱了。而我那时还在大学里“烧钱”呢。每次放假回家，父亲总是说着堂弟致富的传奇，口气里都是惊羡，后来渐渐表达对我读书见效慢的责备，从叹息到抱怨，搞得我不敢和堂弟同时出现。

;

;反转出现在我工作的第二年。堂弟开始欠债，他做生意喜欢猛进，加之很早进入社会摸爬滚打，有了固执的自信，对老人的劝诫当耳旁风。东处挪钱，西处洽谈，成了常态，渐渐入不敷出。开始三叔觉得家资雄厚，亏点本不算什么，等发现势头不对为时已晚，堂弟的债务横跨黑白两道，涵盖亲戚朋友，他无力偿还，就摊在了要强的三叔头上。

;

;倾家荡产之后，债务只填上十分之一，已经当了爷爷可颐享天年的三叔决定从头再来，他把年轻时的手艺操持起来，同时打着两三份工，以惊人的毅力赚钱还债。亲戚的债务、银行的贷款……一笔又一笔，全靠他和三婶两个人支撑偿还。而习惯于在钱堆里打滚的堂弟，无法接受没钱的日子，在欠债之后直接躺平，天大的事情让父母顶着，就连他自己的儿子都是老人一边打工一边照料。

;

;这样的日子已持续十年，债务总算还得差不多。我没多大变化，就是亦步亦趋上班下班，变化的是父亲和三叔。父亲开始庆幸当年自己对于教育的投入，虽然我没挣什么大钱，但学会了稳重，不易“学坏”，对我也比从前多了肯定。三叔开始重复着说“念书多好”，教育是要花钱，但这个钱值得花，因为念了书的人就有“把门的”，做事就有东西拉着，不会一直“踩油门”，不管不顾。

;

;后来我渐渐明白，教育固然不是万能的，可能无法直接解决就业、赚钱等这些很现实的问题。但没有教育是万万不能的，我们常常会将教育和社会想成因果关系，教育必须对进入社会能做什么负责，否则便是无用的。其实，教育的一大功能是对进入社会不做什么负责，不能只盯着“有所为”，还要注重“有所不为”。透过三叔的话，我想无论家庭教育、学校教育、社会教育，如果专注于将教育当成利禄的“油门”，那么注定会失控，越来越“快”的时代，需要教育作为“刹车”的作用。

;

;（作者为长春媒体人）

;;Recently, a cliff was excavated in Nanjiang County, Bazhong, Sichuan more than 1,400 years ago in the late Northern Wei Dynasty. The statues were defaced and vandalized, causing concern. ;

;

;

;;

;

;

;;

;

;< img src="https://images.infzm.com/cms/medias/image/23/11/15/f853a85bd792a1975d1d34c3a761dd02.png" border="0" style="opacity: 1;" width="1080" height= "688" data-src="//images.infzm.com/cms/medias/image/23/11/15/f853a85bd792a1975d1d34c3a761dd02.png" data-key="258374">;

; Wed, 15 Nov 2023 16:55:03 +0800 药品还是毒品？女子网上转售父亲遗留止疼药一审判贩毒罪http://www.infzm.com/contents/260629
;;2023-11-15 16:00:00;
;

;;

;

;In July 2023, Liao Hua Photos of medicines posted by patients’ medicine transfer group. Photo provided by the interviewee

;

;Recently, Guangzhou woman Liao Hua (pseudonym) was pursued across provinces by Shandong police on suspicion of drug trafficking, which attracted attention. Liao Hua repeatedly stated that the analgesic drugs she resold for 260 yuan were left behind by her father after his death. With the idea of ​​saving and not wasting, she transferred the drugs among her patients, not knowing that they were "drugs."
;

;

;The Yangxin County Court of Shandong Province held in the first instance that Liao Hua violated national regulations on drug management and, for the purpose of profit, trafficked drugs controlled by national regulations. Psychotropic drugs that make humanoids addictive constitute the crime of drug trafficking. In the first instance, he was sentenced to two months' detention, suspended for three months, and fined RMB 1,000.

;

;Liao Hua said that after the verdict of the first instance was announced, the more she thought about it, the more aggrieved she became. Previously, she only thought that she was violating laws and regulations by selling prescription drugs, but she did not expect that it would be a serious criminal charge such as "drug trafficking". Since her job is administrative accounting, the criminal stain will greatly affect her career development. Liao Hua chose to appeal. At the end of October 2023, the second instance of the case was heard in Binzhou Intermediate Court, and no verdict has been announced yet.

;

;On November 13, the judge in charge of the Binzhou Intermediate Court case told Southern Weekend reporters that the court will conduct an investigation in accordance with legal provisions, and the direction and progress of the investigation will be determined during the trial. It won't be announced until it's over.

;

;Both drugs and drugs

;

;Liao Hua said that the drugs he sold were all leftovers taken by his father before his death. Liao Hua's father suffered from advanced rectal cancer. During the treatment, he often suffered fractures and suffered severe pain. The hospital prescribed many types of painkillers. After his father died of a serious illness, Liao Hua didn't know what to do with the leftover medicine.

;

;In July 2023, Liao Hua entered a "patients exchange residual medicine transfer group" through the introduction of patients, and transferred his father's remaining 15 medicines to treat COVID-19, joint pain, etc. Put the medicines together, take photos and send them to the WeChat group. At that time, a person nicknamed "Xiao Wang" in the group quickly added Liao Hua and sent a private message to inquire about purchasing tramalin hydrochloride and telenine.

;

;Liao Hua told Southern Weekend reporters that after the accident, she noticed that although people in the group often switched drugs, most of them were anti-cancer and chemotherapy drugs. Painkillers are less common. The three boxes of tramalin hydrochloride and two boxes of Telenine that she resold to Xiao Wang for 260 yuan were "other narcotic drugs and psychotropic drugs controlled by the state that can induce humanoid addiction."

;

;On July 14, 2023, after receiving the express delivery, Xiao Wang drove to the local police station, reporting that he had purchased the national drug online without a prescription. Controlled drugs, “These are narcotics and can also be regarded as drugs.” The police's transcript of their inquiry showed that Xiao Wang was a drug addict in Yangxin County, Shandong Province. He had "skated on the ice" (smoked methamphetamine) before and wanted to use these drugs as a substitute.

;

;Tang Jianbin, a lawyer at Beijing Jingdu Law Firm who has long represented drug criminal cases, told Southern Weekend reporters that the national drug control targets include traditional drugs such as heroin, methamphetamine, and marijuana. In addition, there is also a type of "narcotic drugs" that have both medicinal properties and drug properties.

;

;Tang Jianbin introduced that in judicial practice, to judge whether it is a "drug", we must first check whether the substance is in the list of anesthetic drugs controlled by the state, that is, the state The latest "Catalogue of Narcotic Drugs", "Catalog of Psychotropic Drugs" and "Supplementary Catalog of Controlled Varieties of Non-Medicinal Narcotic Drugs and Psychotropic Drugs" released by the Food and Drug Administration, the Ministry of Public Security and the National Health Commission.

;

;Southern Weekend reporter checked and found that these lists are dynamically updated. For example, codeine in cough drops is an analgesic, but due to its addiction Sex, as early as 2000, there was an addiction to cough drops. Relevant departments have successively issued a series of regulations, requiring "sales based on prescriptions", "sales and purchases in appropriate amounts" and "monitoring of flows"; in 2015, codeine-containing compound oral liquid preparations were included in the second category of psychotropic drug control.

;

;The tramalin hydrochloride resold by Liao Hua this time is a central analgesic, mostly used for various postoperative pain relief, cancer pain, labor pain, etc. treat. Excessive use can cause bradycardia, convulsions, respiratory depression and coma, and is addictive. In 2008, tramadol (including its salts, single preparations and possible isomers) was included in the Class II psychotropic drugs for control. However, tramadol’s compound preparations will only be included in the Class II psychotropic drugs on July 1, 2023.

;

;Tylenine (oxycodone tablets), another drug resold by Liao Hua, is a compound preparation of oxycodone and is also widely used clinically. Analgesic drugs were included in the management of Class II psychotropic drugs on September 1, 2019.

;

;After July 1, 2023, the nationally controlled varieties of anesthetic drugs and non-medicinal anesthetic drugs have reached 456 types and 2 entire categories (fentanyl, nicotine and synthetic cannabinoids).

;

;"Listed" means that tramalin hydrochloride and oxycodone paracetamol have dual properties of drugs and drugs. "The first is the nature of drugs," Tang Jianbin explained. The listing of these anesthetic drugs does not automatically equate to drugs. They will only become "drugs" if they flow into the illegal drug market or are smoked by drug addicts.

;

;In accordance with the relevant provisions of the "2023 National Court Drug Crime Trial Work Conference Minutes" (Kunming Conference Minutes) issued by the Supreme People's Court on June 26, 2023, knowingly Criminals or drug addicts who smuggle or sell drugs and sell narcotic drugs or psychotropic drugs that are controlled by the state and have legal medical or other uses shall be convicted and punished for the crime of drug trafficking.

;

;According to the minutes of the Kunming meeting, "there is definite evidence to prove that for the purpose of treating diseases and other related purposes", those who privately operate anesthetic drugs with legal medical purposes are not allowed to Punished as a drug crime.

;

;Therefore, whether Liao Hua still sold tramalin hydrochloride and paracetamol and oxycodone even though he knew that the other party was a drug addict has become the key to the case. .

;

;;

;

;Liao Hua’s chat history with drug buyers. Photo provided by the interviewee

;

;Is it "fishing for law enforcement"?

;

;During the process of purchasing drugs online, Xiao Wang once revealed that he was a drug addict. The chat records between the two parties show that Xiao Wang once said: "I used to skate, but now I can't buy it. I use these medicines instead! I'm still a little addicted now! It's too hard to quit." Liao Hua did not reply immediately, and Xiao Wang later mentioned To: "I'm not sick. I used to play music and smoke marijuana, but it's hard to find it now! Use this medicine to replace it!"

;

;Liao Hua argued, She didn’t know what “skating” meant, and her understanding of tramalin hydrochloride and telenine had always been limited to painkillers. She didn't pay attention to the words Xiao Wang said about addiction and difficulty in quitting. After sending the medicine, she also suggested that if Xiao Wang had pain, he could try acupuncture of traditional Chinese medicine. This was her previous pain relief experience when taking care of her father.

;

;Fu Chengchen, a lawyer at Hubei Today Law Firm, believes that the key to this case is whether it can be determined that "drugs" were knowingly committed. Liao Hua's above statement can be used as a defense reason, but objectively Liao Hua has carried out the act of selling "drugs", and what she resold is the medicine that her father has used. She is very clear about the effects of the medicine, and may even prescribe medicine before the doctor During the process, you will have a certain understanding of the nature of controlled prescription drugs. To determine that he "did not know" it was a drug, further evidence and the judge's discretion are needed.

;

;According to another chat record provided by Liao Hua, she also donated fentanyl pain relief patches to a gastric cancer patient who had undergone surgery, and the other party expressed her gratitude. . Liao Hua said that his original intention was to help patients, not to sell medicine specifically.

;

;One ​​month after the incident, Xiao Wang, who had contacted Liao Hua to buy medicine, once again added friends in the WeChat group who wanted to transfer medicine. . Liao Hua noticed that the group photo of drugs transferred also included Tramalin Hydrochloride Sustained Release Tablets. She suspected that the man was "fishing."

;

;Tang Jianbin analyzed that when drug addicts purchase alternative drugs in drug switching groups, they actively indicate that their drug taking behavior is not consistent with common sense. In this case, these few sentences constitute the key to Liao Hua's drug trafficking crime. It is necessary to consider whether this approach is suspected of "criminal inducement", that is, the party himself does not have the intention to commit the crime, and special personnel induce him to commit the crime.

;

;According to the minutes of the Kunming meeting, evidence materials obtained when there is "criminal inducement" by persons who conceal their identity should be excluded. After excluding the above evidence, if the evidence in the case does not meet the standard of proof to find the seduced person guilty, a not guilty verdict shall be made in accordance with the law because the evidence is insufficient and the alleged crime cannot be established.

;

;But currently, there is no definite evidence for the "fishing law enforcement" questioned by Liao Hua. In the relevant transcripts, the reporter took the initiative to drive to the police station to report the crime, and did not mention his identity as a police informant. Southern Weekend reporters contacted Xiao Wang several times but received no reply. On November 13, staff from the Yangxin County Public Security Bureau stated that because the case was in the second instance, it was inconvenient to disclose relevant information.

;

;Fu Chengchen reminded that private resale of drugs is not allowed without a drug business license; reselling controlled drugs involves criminal penalties, and reselling general drugs also involves serious crimes. If the amount does not meet the standard for filing a criminal case, you will also face administrative penalties.

;

;In the patient group, after someone forwarded Liao Hua’s case report, the group announcement read: “Dear patients and family members of patients, the country has strict regulations on painkillers. Control, contains drug content, and private trading is an illegal crime. In the light case, the person will be detained on bail pending trial, and in the serious case, he will be sentenced. Please abide by the law!"

; Wed, 15 Nov 2023 16:25:04 +0800 校准航向再出发——新华社五论中美关系如何重返正轨http://www.infzm.com/contents/260645
;;2023-11-15 15:30:00;
;

;At the invitation of US President Biden, President Xi Jinping will go to San Francisco, the United States from November 14th to 17th. The heads of state of China and the United States met and were invited to attend the 30th APEC Economic Leaders’ Meeting. The two heads of state will have in-depth communication on strategic, overall and directional issues related to China-US relations, as well as major issues related to world peace and development.

;

;Heads of State diplomacy is the "compass" and "fixing star" of Sino-US relations. Therefore, all walks of life in China and the United States and the international community are looking forward to this meeting in San Francisco. They look forward to Sino-US relations under the guidance of the heads of state's diplomacy strategy. Get back on the right track of healthy and stable development as soon as possible. At this critical juncture, Xinhua News Agency launched a series of commentary reports on "Pushing China-U.S. Relations Back on Track", calling on the United States to work with China to meet each other halfway, overcome interference, eliminate obstacles, accumulate results, create an atmosphere, and jointly promote China-U.S. relations to return to healthy and stable development. track.

;

;;;On the return to the consensus of the heads of state: ;;;;Return to Bali, to San Francisco;;< /h4>;

;;

;

;To make expectations for stable and developed Sino-US relations a reality, China and the United States need to meet each other halfway. The action road map is also very clear, which is to return to Bali and lead to San Francisco, truly implement the consensus reached by the Chinese and US presidents at the Bali meeting, expand the positive agenda of bilateral relations, reduce the negative agenda, create conditions for the San Francisco meeting, eliminate interference, and accumulate results and create an atmosphere. There is no doubt that the journey back to Bali and to San Francisco will not be smooth sailing, and we cannot rely on "automatic driving".

;

;Only by returning to Bali can we lead to San Francisco. Returning to Bali is the foundation and prerequisite. In recent times, China-US relations have shown some positive signs precisely because the follow-up and implementation of the consensus reached by the two heads of state in Bali has been accelerated.

;

;We hope that the positive stance shown by the United States in recent interactions between China and the United States is not political calculation and tactical speculation, and that the verbal commitments made can become concrete policies and substantive actions. We also hope that the United States will not be fettered by domestic party disputes and the selfish interests of politicians, and will work together with China to make long-term efforts to accumulate good news and momentum in China-U.S. relations and promote the real stabilization and improvement of bilateral relations.

;

;As the most important set of bilateral relations in the world, Sino-US relations affect the future and destiny of mankind. During the meeting in Bali, President Xi Jinping emphasized that Sino-US relations should be viewed and handled from the perspective of grasping the general trend of the world. What is the general trend of the world? It is peace, development, cooperation, and win-win that have become the trend of the times, and no country or group of countries can dominate world affairs alone; it is the era of the "Great Awakening" in the global South, and human society is accelerating into a multi-polar world; it is the time for humankind to transcend We are increasingly becoming a community with a shared future in which we are among you and you are among us. At the same time, we are also facing many global challenges.

;

;;;Second Discussion on Calibrating the Course of Relationship:;;;;China and the United States must find the right way to get along;;

;

;;;

;As two world powers, whether China and the United States can establish a correct way to get along is crucial to world peace and development and the future and destiny of mankind. For some time, the changes in the relationship between the two countries have affected the hearts of the world. Its ups and downs have shown the seriousness and complexity of Sino-US relations. It is not easy to establish a correct way for major countries to get along with each other. It will be affected by various factors. On the other hand, the two sides finally eliminated the interference and reached the important consensus of "returning to Bali" and "facing San Francisco", which once again proved that as long as we have a responsible attitude towards history, the world and the people, we can establish a correct attitude towards each other. With rational understanding and the greatest sincerity in improving relations, Sino-US relations can develop in a positive direction, truly stabilize and get better, and return to the right track of healthy and stable development.

;

;As for how China and the United States can get along correctly, President Xi Jinping has already given a clear answer, which is mutual respect, peaceful coexistence, and win-win cooperation. These three principles are important conclusions drawn from examining the ups and downs of Sino-US relations for more than half a century. They are the correct way for major countries to interact with each other in today's era. They are the key to ensuring that the two giant ships of China and the United States do not yaw, stall, or interact with each other. hit an important beacon.

;

;Without respect, there is no trust; without trust, there is no way to avoid conflicts and no real cooperation. This is an important experience accumulated in Sino-US exchanges and a basic prerequisite for bilateral relations to get back on track. Keeping the bottom line of peace is the right choice that China and the United States must make. Win-win cooperation has been the true narrative of Sino-US relations for half a century, and it is also the common goal that both sides should continue to strive for.

;

;Along the way from Bali, the recovery of Sino-US relations has been hard-won and deserves to be cherished. Facing San Francisco, both sides should draw inspiration from the past, gather forces that work toward each other, jointly explore and build a new era of Sino-US relations, and create a bright future for both China and the United States.

;

;;;Three discussions on correctly defining relationships: ;;;;Competition and confrontation are not in line with the trend of the times;;

;

;;

; < p>;How Sino-US relations develop ultimately depends on the two major countries’ understanding of each other. If cooperation dominates the perception, bilateral relations will develop in a good direction; if competition dominates the perception or even defines the entire relationship by competition, antagonism will continue to increase, and there is a risk of slipping into the abyss of a "new cold war." At present, the key for the United States to straighten out its relations with China is to establish a correct understanding of China, get out of zero-sum game thinking, accumulate and expand cooperation, and continue to promote the stabilization and improvement of Sino-US relations.

;

;As two major countries, China and the United States have both cooperation and competition in trade, technology, diplomacy and other fields. It is not about you losing and me winning, or life and death, but you should be catching up with each other and making progress together. China does not shy away from competition nor is it afraid of competition, but competition should be fair, reasonable, and benign, with red lines and restricted areas. We cannot ignore market economic rules and basic norms of international relations, let alone use issues of core interests as a tool of competition or a means of provocation. Competition in China should be track and field events. There are tracks and rules, and you can improve your own performance while chasing each other. Just like what athletes pursue in competition is to constantly improve themselves, break through themselves, and achieve better results, rather than giving other athletes "Stumbling" or malicious interference, otherwise you will only be ejected for violating the rules.

;

;Competition is not the whole story of Sino-US relations. The economies of China and the United States are more complementary than competitive. The essence of China-US economic and trade cooperation is mutual benefit and win-win results. Under the current situation, the common interests between China and the United States have not decreased, but have increased.

;

;As two major countries, China and the United States bear important responsibilities for the prosperity and development of mankind. Whether we will jointly open a new era of human development through cooperation or slide into the abyss of conflict and confrontation between major powers is the question of the century that the two countries must answer. Breaking out of the narrow perspective of who wins and who loses and pursuing the noble goal of winning together for mankind should become the common pursuit of China and the United States in the new era.

;

;;;Four Discussions on Improving Cooperation Consensus: ;;;;The earth can accommodate China and the United States’ respective development and common prosperity;;

;

;;

;

;In recent times, the trend of positive interaction between China and the United States has been increasing. On the one hand, the United States continues to introduce restrictive measures on China's science and technology, economic and trade cooperation, driven by the consciousness of "competition". On the other hand, it also seeks to contact China through various channels, showing signs of "seeking common ground" that has been rare in recent years. Fundamentally, China and the United States are the two largest economies in the world. Sino-US relations are the most important bilateral relations in the world. The economic ties between the two countries are deep and wide. Neither the two countries nor the world can afford miscalculation of intentions and confrontation and conflict. heavy.

;

;The development and progress of China and the United States can become opportunities rather than challenges for each other. The economies of the two countries are more complementary than competitive. China and the United States should be mutually beneficial and win-win rather than a zero-sum game. Both sides can achieve each other's achievements. Make the pie of common interests bigger.

;

;China-US cooperation not only has existing advantages, but also has incremental advantages. Although China and the United States are each other's important trading partners, with an annual trade volume of hundreds of billions of dollars, there is still room for growth in bilateral trade, which is unmatched by bilateral economic and trade relations between the United States and other countries. Cooperation will open up more room for growth in a wider range of areas for both parties. Technology research and development exchanges and joint investments in the field of "carbon neutrality" will benefit both parties; the demand for medical services by the aging population in China and the United States will increase significantly in the future, and the exchange of medical technology and data will bring great value to both parties; China's ultra-large-scale medium Income groups provide immeasurable potential markets for U.S. agricultural products; both the United States and China benefit from two-way investment flows, and encouraging mutual investment will feed back the economies of both countries from multiple angles... The list of cooperation between the two sides can be very long.

;

;The vast earth can fully accommodate the respective development and common prosperity of China and the United States. The Chinese people, like the American people, are self-respecting, confident and self-reliant people, and both have the right to pursue a better life. The common interests existing between the two countries should be taken seriously. The success of each is an opportunity rather than a threat to the other.

;

;;;Five arguments to consolidate the foundation of public opinion: ;;;;Gather the positive energy of Sino-US exchanges and cooperation;;< /h4>;

;;

;

;Although China and the United States are separated by vast oceans, the people of China and the United States have a long history of exchanges and cooperation. "The relationship between countries lies in the mutual affinity between people." Looking back on the past, the friendly people-to-people exchanges between China and the United States have never been interrupted, and the people of the two countries have also forged a deep friendship during the exchanges, which has played an important role in the development of Sino-US relations. History has fully proved that the people of China and the United States can transcend differences in systems, cultures, and languages ​​and establish a profound friendship. Mutually beneficial and win-win non-governmental exchanges between China and the United States are not only an independent choice made by the two peoples, but also an unstoppable historical trend.

;

;At a time when Sino-US relations are at a critical crossroads, continuous people-to-people exchanges and people-to-people exchanges and cooperation are particularly valuable, injecting a steady stream of positive energy into the healthy development of bilateral relations. The more flights, cargo ships, tourists, and students and scholars across the Pacific, the more solid the public opinion foundation, the broader the space, and the stronger the impetus for the development of China-U.S. relations.

;

;Both China and the United States should handle, manage, and develop bilateral relations with a responsible attitude towards the people of both countries and proceed from the well-being of the two peoples, so as to inherit and carry forward the precious values ​​for the two peoples. The legacy of friendship creates favorable atmosphere and conditions and builds a solid public opinion foundation for friendship and cooperation between the two countries. Recently, the "general climate" of Sino-US relations has been warming up. More and more people from all walks of life in China and the United States are calling for the two countries to expand exchanges and cooperation, working hard to promote mutual understanding and mutual understanding between the two peoples, and sending out a positive message of Sino-US people-to-people friendship.

;

;China-US relations still face many difficulties and challenges, and there is a long way to go to stabilize and improve relations between the two countries. Fortunately, these fundamental people-to-people ties from history still exist, and positive energy to promote the development of Sino-US relations is constantly gathering.
